background_description: Protectors of the harvest, defense against pests, thieves, and beasts. A position of great honor, while it lasts: many guardians do not live out their natural lives. Roll a second time on the **Bonds** table.

Gale Seed Extract.description: Ingesting one lets you sprint with a speed four times your regular rate. Afterward you add two Fatigue.

Bone Knife.description: On Critical Damage, its next attack becomes enhanced from contact with blood.

Diseased Crop.description: Quickly decays any plant it touches.

Bloodvine Whip.description: On Critical Damage it drains the target's blood, granting the weapon's next attack the blast quality.

Sun Stick.description: Recharge: Leave in heavy sunlight for a full day.

Everbloom Band.description: On taking Critical Damage the flowers dissolve into dust, but you act as if your save succeeded (STR loss still occurs).

table1.question: What got the better of you? Roll 1d6:

options.description: A voracious swarm of pests that swallowed crops and animals alike. With nothing to defend, you left.
A crop spirit, angered by a poor tithing. The fires consumed nearly everything, and afterwards you were able to gather a pouch of Fireseeds.
An antlered, toothy demon that nearly ended you.
The Withering, a type of stem rot from The Roots.

Wolves, or so you thought. You are now a Werewolf [8 HP, 15 STR, 14 DEX, claws (d6+d6) or bite (d8)]. Your WIL remains the same. You can turn at will (once per day) but must make a WIL save to revert. Anyone left alive from your attacks must make a WIL save to avoid infection.
Crop thieves. Not all of them survived, but you were outnumbered.
